data.title: Level 2 Archives

âPaper Planesâ is a song by British musicianÂ M.I.A.Â from her second studio album,Â KalaÂ (2007). The song ignited wide acclaim upon its release, and contemporary critics complimented the musical direction as well as the subversive, unconventional subject matter of the piece, citing its chorus and lyrical humor in the promotion ofÂ globalization.Â The single peaked in the Top 20 in [â¦]

HieroglyphicsÂ are anÂ AmericanÂ underground hip hopÂ collectiveÂ based inÂ Oakland, California. The collective was founded in the early-1990sÂ byÂ rapperÂ Del tha Funkee Homosapien. The collective is currently composed ofÂ rappersÂ Del the Funky Homosapien,Â Casual,Â Pep Love,Â producer/managerÂ Domino,Â DJ Toure, and the four individual members of the rap groupÂ Souls of Mischief:Â Phesto,Â A-Plus,Â Opio, andÂ Tajai.Â The Hieroglyphics combine fundamentally sound deliveries and lyrical content with original and sometimesÂ jazzyÂ orÂ funkyÂ beats andÂ samples.Â Since their inception, Hieroglyphics [â¦]

It is considered by some music critics one of the greatest hip-hop songs ever recorded.Â The song was produced byÂ Pete Rockwho also sings the songâsÂ chorusand samples âI Love Musicâ byÂ Ahmad JamalÂ and âItâs Yoursâ byÂ T La Rock. A remix of [â¦]

âSurvival of the Fittestâ is the second single fromÂ Mobb DeepâsÂ The InfamousÂ album. The song was the duoâs second hit single from the album, following âShook Ones Pt. IIâ. The track peaked at #69 on theÂ Billboard Hot 100Â charts and hit the Top 10 on theÂ Hot Rap SinglesÂ chart. The song is similar to âShook Ones Pt. IIâ in [â¦]

The duo is from New York but met as teenagers inÂ North Carolina, where both of their families relocated.Â The group was an affiliate of theÂ Native Tongues, which included theÂ Jungle Brothers,Â A Tribe Called Quest, andÂ De La Soul. After getting together in 1989, [â¦]

Corey Scoffern, better known by hisÂ stage nameÂ The Grouch, is anÂ AmericanÂ rapperÂ andÂ producerÂ based inÂ Maui, Hawaii.Â He is a founding member ofÂ Living Legends, anÂ underground hip-hopÂ collective based inÂ Los Angeles, California. The Grouch collaborated with many artists includingÂ Zion I,Â a hip hop duo fromÂ Oakland, California. The duo consists ofÂ producerÂ AmpLiveÂ andÂ MCÂ Zumbi. The group is known to its followers for Ampâs futuristic production techniques, using a [â¦]

Eric B. & Rakim were a hip-hop duo from Long Island, New York. The group was composed of DJ Eric Barrier and MC Rakim, and they are considered by aficionados as one of hip-hopâs greatest pairs. They rose to fame during the âGolden Ageâ of hip-hop, which covered the late 1980s to early 1990s. Eric [â¦]

Sir Mix-a-Lot is one of the most fun-loving and energetic producers. He is based inÂ Seattle, Washington, and he formed the Nastymix Record Label with DJ Nasty Nes. He is most well known for his Grammy award-winning single âBaby Got Backâ, which was released in 1992. In this song, Sir Mix-a-Lot describes his obsession with womenâs [â¦]

Dead Prez is a hip-hop duo from New York City, and its members are stic.man and M-1. They are known for their aggressive and confrontational style, and their lyrics focus on socialism, social justice and Pan-Africanism, which is anÂ ideologyÂ that encourages unity of all Africans worldwide. Dead Prez is particularly critical of corporate-controlled media, and they [â¦]

Bone Thugs n Harmony is a Grammy award-winning group from Cleveland, Ohio. The group consists of five members: Layzie Bone, Flesh-n-Bone, Bizzy Bone, Krayzie Bone and Wish Bone. Easy-E, former member of N.W.A., discovered and signed the group to Ruthless Records in 1993. Four years later, Easy-E passed away from AIDS, and Bone Thugs n [â¦]
